The National Institute of Mental Health (NIMH) communicates their research findings to the general public through various channels, including press releases, social media, newsletters, and meetings with stakeholders. NIMH hosts an annual research symposium that highlights the latest research findings in the field of mental health. They also have a website that provides easy-to-understand information about mental illnesses, including research updates and resources for treatment and support.

NIMH makes a strong effort to make their information more accessible to those who are not experts in the field. They provide educational materials, such as fact sheets and brochures, that explain mental illnesses and their treatment options in simple language. They also offer videos and webinars featuring experts discussing mental health research and treatment topics. NIMH encourages public input and engagement in research efforts, providing opportunities for patients, families, and caregivers to participate in clinical trials and provide feedback on research projects.

Overall, NIMH focuses on communicating their research findings to the public in a clear and understandable way, aiming to increase awareness and knowledge of mental health issues and to facilitate a bridge between researchers and the general public.
